pr_title: Return higher level object GetObjectResponse for getObject API

timeline.message: Return higher level object GetObjectResponse for getObject API
Return higher level object GetObjectResponse for getObject API

timeline.bodyText: Why not extend from GenericResponse and have just one instance variable for InputStream body ?
timeline.author: anjalshireesh
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,103 @@

+package io.minio;
+
+import java.io.IOException;
+import java.io.InputStream;
+import okhttp3.Headers;
+
+public class GetObjectResponse extends InputStream {

replies.bodyText:
InputStream body by public InputStream body() is already there.
We want GetObjectResponse needs to be an InputStream and have functionality of GenericResponse. As GenericResponse and InputStream are abstract classes, I cannot inherit both the classes, but inherit one class (InputStream) and have instance of another class (GenericResponse); if we do other way around; InputStream capability is lost.
replies.author: balamurugana

replies.bodyText: @balamurugana the InputStream capability won't be lost. We can get the InputStream by calling body() from the instance of GetObjectResponse to get the input stream.
replies.author: anjalshireesh

replies.bodyText: The idea here is to GetObjectResponse be an InputStream which is most common usage and it doesn't break backward compatibility.
replies.author: balamurugana

replies.bodyText:
Backward compatibility with the previous return type of the method - understood 👍
In that case, may I suggest to remove all the wrapper methods that call the same method on the response object, and expect the client to call response() method to get the object of BaseResponse and then use it to get further details? We can also consider making the GenericResponse non-abstract and using it directly.
replies.author: anjalshireesh

timeline.bodyText:
GetObjectResponse can extend from BufferedInputStream and then call super(body) here inside the constructor.
With this, The class would authentically become an InputStream and would not need to store the body variable and write wrapper methods for it.
timeline.author: anjalshireesh

replies.bodyText:
We would need to keep proxying methods in GenericResponse here to comply with other Response classes; else GetObjectResponse looks different. The idea is GetObjectResponse is same as GenericResponse but also an InputStream.


Yes. Making GenericResponse as non-abstract class.


I am going to use FilterInputStream which is more appropriate than BufferedInputStream
replies.author: balamurugana
